alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Lee; Ogle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 13 at 2:17PM CST until January 14 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO 9 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills of 30 to 35 degrees below zero expected. For the Winter Weather Advisory, very low visibility due to falling and blowing snow expected. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills of 20 to 30 degrees below zero expected. * WHERE...Ogle, Lee and De Kalb Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 3 AM CST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight tonight to noon CST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon Sunday to 9 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on pockets of very low visibility due to falling and blowing snow, especially in open areas and on north to south oriented roadways. If planning to travel, expect slowed speeds and include emergency supplies in your vehicle. Ensure others know your travel plans in case you get stuck. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as few as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.
